{
  "file": "Login.aspx.cs",
  "vulnerabilities": [
    {
      "title": "Insecure JWT Handling",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-352",
      "description": "The JWT is generated and stored in a cookie without proper validation or signing mechanisms, which could lead to token forgery or replay attacks.",
      "line_numbers": [36, 37],
      "recommendation": "Ensure that the JWT is signed using a strong algorithm and validate the token on each request. Consider using libraries that handle JWT securely."

    {
      "title": "Potential Information Disclosure",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-209",
      "description": "The application provides a generic error message for invalid credentials, which could lead to information disclosure about valid usernames.",
      "line_numbers": [25, 45],
      "recommendation": "Avoid revealing whether the username or password is incorrect. Use a generic error message for all authentication failures."
    },
    {
      "title": "Session Fixation Vulnerability",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-384",
      "description": "The application does not invalidate the session after successful authentication, which could allow an attacker to hijack a session.",
      "line_numbers": [30, 31],
      "recommendation": "Invalidate the previous session and create a new session upon successful login to prevent session fixation attacks."
    },
    {
      "title": "Lack of Rate Limiting on Login Attempts",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-307",
      "description": "The application does not implement rate limiting on login attempts, making it susceptible to brute force attacks.",
      "line_numbers": [20, 21],
      "recommendation": "Implement rate limiting on login attempts to mitigate brute force attacks. Consider using CAPTCHA after a certain number of failed attempts."
    }
  ]
}
